title: Lee Zeldin
deleted: During Donald Trump's presidency, Zeldin was a staunch Trump loyalist. Zeldin was a prominent defender of Trump during his impeachment hearings in relation to the Trump-Ukraine scandal. After Trump lost to Joe Biden in the 2020 presidential election and refused to concede, Zeldin defended Trump and aided him in his efforts to overturn the election. He signed onto a lawsuit seeking to overturn the election; the lawsuit repeated false, disproven, and unsubstantiated accusations of fraud in swing states won by Biden. In January 2021, Zeldin objected to the certification of the election results in Congress based on spurious allegations of widespread voter fraud<ref>{{Cite news|last=Yourish|first=Karen|last2=Buchanan|first2=Larry|last3=Lu|first3=Denise|date=2021-01-07|title=The 147 Republicans Who Voted To Overturn Election Results|language=en-US|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2021/01/07/us/elections/electoral-college-biden-objectors.html|access-date=2021-01-07|issn=0362-4331}}</ref>.

title: Lee Zeldin
deleted: On January 13, 2021, he committed sedition by voting against the impeachment of President Trump.

title: Lee Zeldin
deleted: He voted not to impeach the traitor Trump on Jan 13 2021, and is thereby complicit in the insurrection.
